Topic.Title: Historic super typhoon, gusts of 200 mph

Message.Msg: There are also about four different typhoon zones in the Pacific & Indian Ocean. North West Pacific (north Japan, China & Koreas); South West Pacific (South Japan, China & Asia); Eastern Pacific (off coast of Baja California); Central Pacific (Hawaii); Eastern Australia & Indian Ocean. Each of these zones has different data sets and different time periods the data has been scientifically collected Also different gov agencies collecting the data. All data sets are incomplete prior to satellite tracking beginning around 1960.

Message.Title: WSJ: record corporate profits
Message.Msg: (in 2011 corporate profits were breaking records and were above the pre recession peak in 2006 (adjusted for inflation0 and of course, 2012 was even better for corporate profits! 4/2012 WSJ -- "Big U.S. companies have emerged from the deepest recession since World War II more productive, more profitable, flush with cash and less burdened by debt. An analysis by The Wall Street Journal of corporate financial reports finds that cumulative sales, profits and employment last year among members of the Standard & Poor's 500-stock index exceeded the totals of 2007, before the recession and financial crisis. The chart above shows after-tax corporate profits for U.S. corporations as a whole, which set a new record high in 2011 of more than $1.5 trillion, and were 20.5% above the pre-recession peak of $1.26 trillion in 2006 (adjusted for inflation).

Message.Title: The Dark Side of Special Dividends
Message.Msg: The most important aspect of special dividends is that they are symptomatic of a sea-change in companies' outlook for the future of American Investment Capital... it's formation, and it's deployment. Simply put, President Obama has been threatening for years to punish capitalism with high taxes on those who provide and deploy investment capital into the U.S. The special dividends are simply a final, low-tax distribution to shareholders before the dark ages of U.S. investment sets in... ... probably accompanied by low growth, high un-employment, and minimal capital investment that is so characteristic of the countries that have followed the path of socialism and wealth re-distribution before us. We saw just the opposite in 1997, as Bill Clinton worked with the new, GOP dominated congress to lower capital gains taxes and unleash a torrent of tax revenues that grew the economy, minimized unemployment and balanced the budget. Obama's anti-capitalism crusade of punishing the sources of those same revenue streams should be expected to produce the exact opposite result. As for the special dividends themselves, under better presidential leadership, the companies paying these dividends might be expected to RETAIN those earnings and invest them into new american industry and more american jobs. I would contend that it isn't just getting under the wire on the 15% dividend tax that's driving the torrent of special dividends... but also the fact that many american companies simply don't see growth opportunities in the U.S. over the next 4 years, so they may as well return the money to shareholders to ship offshore or dive into bonds and gold. Socialism is a harsh lesson for countries to learn about in this way... but few american citizens truly understand what they're doing when a 20-something votes for Obama because he saw him on TV with Justin Bieber... ... Mr. Obama was highly reliant on such voters to NOT have an understanding of what his main supporters... Hugo Chavez and Raul Castro... had done to their countries before Mr. Obama set his sites on doing likewise to ours. Spokanimal

Message.Title: Simpson-Bowles plan ended W's tax cuts for the rich ONLY, same as Obama
Message.Msg: letting the Bush tax cuts for income over $250,000 expire is Simpson-Bowles reform. "Simpson-Bowles begins by assuming the expiration of the Bush tax cuts for income over $250,000. It’s built into the “plausible baseline,” which you can read about on page 62 of the proposal. Having banked the revenue from those tax cuts, it then turns to tax reform. In total, Simpson-Bowles ends up raising about $2.6 trillion in taxes. That’s a lot more than the $1.6 trillion Obama is looking for. But both Obama and Simpson-Bowles start the same way: By letting the Bush tax cuts expire for income over $250,000."

Message.Title: Boehner kicks 2 teaparty loon pubs off house budget committee
Message.Msg: good move Boehner WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Two of the most conservative Republicans in the House of Representatives have been kicked off the House Budget Committee, a rare move that could make it easier for the panel to advance a deal with Democrats to cut fiscal deficits. Representatives Tim Huelskamp of Kansas and Justin Amash of Michigan - both favorites of the anti-tax Tea Party movement - are among those Republicans voting most often against House Speaker John Boehner.

Message.Msg: ... Mr. Obama thinks that isn't fair. His proposals would jack them up well over 40% of total revenues. Currently, the bottom 47% pay no federal income taxes. Mr. Obama thinks that's fair but has said that he would like to exempt half of all americans from contributing anything... presumably the half that votes him into office. When the 47% were highlighted, the left screamed that they pay FICA (social security insurance)... so the "employee's" portion of FICA was reduced from 6.2% to 4.2%... while the EMPLOYER'S half of FICA was left at 6.2%. Mr. Obama think's it's fair that the employer pay for 60% of their employee's social security (yes, Virginia, they built that TOO). Currently, dividends are taxed at a max of 15% after the corporate earnings they are attributed to are taxed at a max of 35%... for a total of 50% tax on those earnings. Mr. Obama thinks that's unfair and want's the dividends taxed at 39.6% plus the obamacare tax of 3.8%... ... that would make the total tax paid on corporate earnings distributed as dividends taxed at a rate of 78.4%... Incredibly, Mr. Obama think's that is "fair". Mr. Obama says daily that the wealthy should pay "just a LITTLE bit more"... ... I guess TRIPPLING the dividend tax is "just a little bit"... and, in Mr. Obama's eye's, it's "fair". S
